associated_skills: Data Visualization (Histograms, Bar Charts, Scatter Plots)
Python (Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib) or R Programming
course_content_outline: Week 1: Introduction to Types of Statistics, Variables, and Cross-Section vs Time Series Data
Week 2: Organizing and Graphing Qualitative and Quantitative Data and Frequency Distributions
Week 3: Numerical Descriptive Data: Measures of Central Tendency and Positions for Grouped/Ungrouped Data
Week 4: Probability: Experiments, Outcomes, Sample Spaces, and Independent vs Dependent Events
Week 5: Discrete Random Variables: Probability Distributions and Measures
Week 6: Continuous Random Variables: Probability Distributions and Measures
Week 7: Sampling Distributions: Population Distributions and Applications
Week 8-9: Estimation: Point and Interval Estimates for Population Mean (Known/Unknown Standard Deviation)
Week 10-11: Hypothesis Testing: Testing Hypotheses about Mean (Known/Unknown Standard Deviation)
Week 12-13: Estimation and Hypothesis Test: Inference about Mean Difference between Two Populations
Week 14: Regression and Correlation Analysis

associated_skills: Linear Algebra Solvers (LU Factorization, Gauss Elimination)
course_content_outline: Week 1: Briefing Session, Computational Algorithms, and Fundamental Tools for Mathematical Computing
Week 2-3: Iterative Methods for Nonlinear Equations: Bisection, Secant, False Position, and Newton Raphson Methods
Week 4: Systems of Linear Equations: Gauss Elimination Techniques
Week 5: Systems of Linear Equations: LU Factorization Methods
Week 6: Systems of Linear Equations: Iterative Techniques
Week 7-8: Numerical Differentiation and Numerical Integration
Week 9-10: Least Squares Approximation: Linear and Polynomial Regression Algorithms
Week 11-12: Interpolation and Approximation: Curve Fitting, Lagrange, Newton Interpolations, and Cubic Spline
Week 13-14: Assignment Presentations and Project Demonstrations

course_name: Instructional Technology and Design In Courseware Development
associated_skills: Instructional Design Models (ADDIE, Dick and Carey, ASSURE)
Mayer's Cognitive Theory of Multimedia Learning
Courseware Development Methodology (Mobile, VR, AR, Serious Games)
course_content_outline: Week 1: Introduction to Instructional Technology, Systems Design, Software, and Courseware
Week 2: Learning Theories in Courseware Development: Behaviorism, Cognitivism, and Constructivism
Week 3-4: Instructional System Design Models: ADDIE, Dick and Carey, ASSURE, Kemp, Kirkpatrick, and Gerlach-Ely
Week 5-6: Cognitive Theory of Multimedia Learning (Mayer's Theory) and Multimedia Elements
Week 7: User Interface Design: Design Principles and Storyboarding
Week 8: Motivation in Designing Courseware: Intrinsic and Extrinsic Motivation
Week 9-11: Courseware Development Methodology for Mobile Apps, Games, VR, AR, and Web-based Learning
Week 12: Courseware Evaluation: Heuristic Evaluation, Expert Review, and Cognitive Walkthrough
Week 13-14: Final Project Assessment and Submission
Week 1: Introduction to Educational Concepts, Types of Education, and Multidisciplinary Perspectives
Week 2-4: Planning for Instruction I: Curriculum Models, Teaching and Learning Styles, and Planning Elements
Week 5-7: Planning for Instruction II: Instructional Objectives, Alignment, and Formative/Summative Assessments
Week 8-9: Basics of Instructional Models: Behavioral Systems, Information-Processing, Social, and Personal Families
Week 10-11: Advanced Instructional Models: Inquiry, Synectics, Integrative, Socratic Seminar, and Cooperative Learning
Week 12-13: Best Educational Practices: Effective Classroom Environments through Planning and Management
Week 14: Traditional vs. Next Generation Models: Adapting to Blended Learning and Flipped Classrooms
Week 1: Introduction to Courseware Engineering and Computers in Teaching & Learning
Week 2: Software Engineering Methodologies: Waterfall, Prototyping, and Scrum
Week 3-7: Courseware Development: Engineering Approaches, Tools, and Testing (Alpha & Beta)
Week 8: Application of Property Rights (IPR): Law, Ethics, and Educational Issues
Week 9-10: Courseware Evaluation: Types, Methods, Sampling, and Instruments
Week 11: Packaging and Delivery: Mediums (CD/Internet) and Price Setting
Week 12-13: Group Project Presentations and Educational Software Showcases
Week 14: Discussion on Technical Report Writing and Final Course Assessments

associated_skills: Software Effort & Cost Estimation (COCOMO I/II, Function Points)
Strategic, Technical, and Economic Feasibility Analysis
course_content_outline: Week 1: Introduction to Software Project Management (SPM) and Career Development in the Field
Week 2: Fundamental Concepts, SPM Lifecycle, and Roles/Responsibilities of a Project Manager
Week 3: Project Initiation Part I: Feasibility Studies, Strategic/Technical Assessment, and Cost-Benefit Analysis
Week 4: Project Initiation Part II: Project Charter Development, Stakeholder Identification, and SPM Tools
Week 5-6: Project Planning: Goal Formalization, Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), and SDP Artifacts
Week 7-9: Software Size and Cost Estimation: Analogy, Function Point Analysis (Albrecht & Mark II), and COCOMO II
Week 10-11: Project Scheduling: Forward/Backward Pass Techniques, Critical Path Analysis, and Gantt Charts
Week 12: Resource Allocation: Identifying Requirements, Scheduling Resources, and Cost Schedules
Week 13: Risk Management: Identification, Prioritization, Control, and Analysis Planning
Week 14: Final Documentation of the Software Development Plan (SDP) and Reporting
Week 1: Course Introduction: Pro Forma, Assignments, Evaluation, and Attendance Requirements
Week 2: Introduction to Software Configuration Management (SCM/CM): History, Concepts, and Benefits
Week 3: SCM/CM Basic Concepts: Configuration Items (CI), Baselines, Versions, Branching, Merging, and Releases
Week 4: Project Planning: Project Types, Management Timelines, Stages, and the Project Management Triangle
Week 5: Project Management in SCM/CM Environment: Typical SCM Plans and SCM-based Components
Week 6: Management of the SCM Process: Methodology, Identification, Change Control, Accounting, and Auditing
Week 7: Configuration Identification: Requirement, Design, and Product Baselines
Week 8: Configuration Change Control: Change Requests (CR), Approval Boards (CCB), and Check-in/Check-out Procedures
Week 9: Configuration Status Accounting (CSA): Information Gathering, Databases, Reports, and Automation
Week 10: Configuration Verification and Audit (CVA): Verification Processes and Effective Auditing Techniques
Week 11: Case Study Presentation: Group Presentations and Technical Discussions
Week 12: SCM Tools: Analysis of Software and Multimedia Tools Supporting SCM Processes
Week 13: Group Project Presentation: Final Implementation Showcase and Peer Discussion
Week 14: SCM/CM Reflection: Integrated Blended Learning Synthesis and Course Wrap-up

associated_skills: Mobile App Design (Native, Hybrid, Mobile Web)
course_content_outline: Week 1-2: Software Design Process, SDLC Phases, Architecture Views (ADV1-3), and Quality Principles
Week 3: Mobile App Design: Native, Mobile Web, and Hybrid Application Domains
Week 4: Mobile Development Challenges: Technical Considerations and Design Quality
Week 5-6: Web App Design: Modern Architectures (SPA, Microservices, Serverless, Cloud-based) and Dynamic Web Techniques
Week 6: API Design: Web API Types, RESTful API Standards, and Source Identification
Week 7: Architectural Design Patterns: Traditional vs. Modern Pattern Analysis
Week 8: Refining Architecture 1: Identifying Design Goals and Subsystem Development
Week 9: Refining Architecture 2: Addressing Performance, Reliability, and Security Evaluation
Week 10: Detailed Design 1: Interface Types (Internal, External, UI) and Navigation/Interaction Design
Week 11: Detailed Design 2: Mapping Subsystems to UI Design Elements and Processes
Week 12: Detailed Design 3: Database Design, API Specifications, and Component Behavior
Week 13: Design Documentation 1: Standards for Format, Structure, and Content Quality
Week 14: Design Documentation 2: Verification of Document Content and Final Review

associated_skills: UML Modeling (Use Case, Sequence, and Activity Diagrams)
Change Management & Version Control for Requirements
course_content_outline: Week 1: Introduction to Software Requirements: Processes, Definitions, and Challenges
Week 2: Software Requirements Types (Business vs. User) and Engineering Core Activities
Week 3-4: Requirements Elicitation 1: Functional, Non-functional (Performance, Security), and Constraints
Week 5-6: Requirements Elicitation 2 & 3: Process Strategies, Elicitation Tools, and Techniques
Week 7-8: Common Elicitation Pitfalls and Requirements Analysis using UML Modeling Standards
Week 9: Requirements Modeling: Creating Abstract Representations for Effective Visualization
Week 10: Requirements Documentation: SRS Format, Structure, Quality Criteria, and Content Delivery
Week 11: Requirements Validation: Verification vs. Validation and Quality Aspect Techniques
Week 12: Requirements Negotiation: Conflict Types and Stakeholder Importance
Week 13: Requirements Management: Status Tracking, Version Control, and Change Procedures
Week 14: Project Presentation: Final Showcase of Group Requirement Elicitation and Modeling

associated_skills: Software Testing Strategies (Unit, Release, User Testing)
course_content_outline: Week 1-2: Introduction to Software Engineering, Educational Software Projects, and Core Process Models (Waterfall, Agile, Incremental)
Week 3: Software Process Part 2: Process Activities, Coping with Change, and Process Improvement
Week 4: Requirements Engineering Part 1: Functional and Non-functional Requirements and Process Overview
Week 5: Requirements Engineering Part 2: Elicitation, Specification, Validation, and Change Management
Week 6: System Modeling: Context, Interaction, Structural, and Behavioral Models
Week 7: Behavioral Diagram Part 1: Detailed Design with Activity Diagrams
Week 8: Behavioral Diagram Part 2: Implementation of Use Case and Sequence Diagrams
Week 9: Architectural Design: Decisions, Views, and Common Architectural Patterns
Week 10: Design and Implementation Part 1: Object-oriented Design using UML and Design Patterns
Week 11: Design and Implementation Part 2: Implementation Issues and Open Source Development
Week 12: Software Testing: Development Testing, Test-driven Development (TDD), and User Testing
Week 13: Software Evolution: Evolution Processes, Legacy Systems, and Maintenance
Week 14: Project Management: Planning, Risk Management, People Management, and Teamwork

associated_skills: Agile Project Management (WBS & Gantt Chart Tracking)
course_content_outline: Week 1: Current Trends in Software Projects: Data Analytics, IoT, Big Data, and Cyber Security
Week 2: Software Process Models and Project Management: Planning, Estimation, WBS, and Risk Management
Week 3: Software Requirements Specification (SRS) and Software Modeling: Functional/Behavioral Diagrams
Week 4: Software Architecture and Design: UI Design, Database Integration, and API Design
Week 5: Development Preparation: Exploring IDEs, Frameworks, and API Communication Standards
Week 6: Project Development (Basic Structure): Defensive Programming and Performance Analysis
Week 7: Project Development (Back-end): Core Logic Implementation and Fault Tolerance
Week 8: Project Development (Database): Implementation of Data Persistence and Integration
Week 9: Project Development (Front-end): Developing User Interaction and Visual Elements
Week 10: Project Development (Security and Error Handling): Refining System Stability and Security
Week 11: Software Testing (Unit and Integration): Black-box, Use-case, and Regressive Testing
Week 12: Software Testing (User Acceptance Test): Evaluating Client Acceptance and Quality Metrics
Week 13: Software Migration: Transferring Data/Systems and Environment Compatibility Testing
Week 14: Project Presentation: Final Software Demonstration and Delivery

associated_skills: Black-Box Testing (Equivalence Partitioning, Boundary Value Analysis)
White-Box Testing (Control Flow & Data Flow Analysis)
course_content_outline: Week 1: Introduction to Software Testing: Importance, Required Skills, and Career Paths
Week 2: Fundamentals of Software Testing: 7 Principles, Artifacts, and Quality Assurance vs. Control
Week 3: Testing Levels and Lifecycles: Component, Integration, System, and Acceptance Testing
Week 4-6: Dynamic Testing Techniques (Black-Box): Partitioning, Boundary Analysis, Decision Tables, and Use Case Testing
Week 7-8: Dynamic Testing Techniques (White-Box): Control Flow, Data Flow, and Technique Selection Criteria
Week 9: Regression Testing: Importance in Agile, Test Suite Development, and Prioritization Techniques
Week 10: User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Functionality, Usability, and Mobile/Web Application Best Practices
Week 11: API Testing: Request Components, Step-by-Step Execution, and Documentation
Week 12: Testing Execution Part I: Planning, Design, and Test Case Creation for Real-Life Case Studies
Week 13: Testing Execution Part II: Test Execution, Result Analysis, and Reporting
Week 14: Static Testing: Roles, Basic Steps, Static Analysis, and Requirements/Design Validation

associated_skills: Agile Project Management (WBS & Gantt Chart Tracking)
course_content_outline: Week 1: Current Trends in Software Projects: Data Analytics, IoT, Big Data, and Cyber Security
Week 2: Software Process Models and Project Management: Planning, Estimation, WBS, and Risk Management
Week 3: Software Requirements Specification (SRS) and Software Modeling: Functional/Behavioral Diagrams

Week 7: Project Development (Back-end): Core Logic Implementation and Fault Tolerance
Week 8: Project Development (Database): Implementation of Data Persistence and Integration

Week 10: Project Development (Security and Error Handling): Refining System Stability and Security

Week 1-2: Introduction to Software Processes: Definitions, Importance, and Case Studies
Week 3: Generic Process Models, Framework Activities, and Assessment & Improvement Processes
Week 4: Software Life Cycle (SDLC) vs. Software Product Life Cycle (SPLC) Tasks and Activities
Week 5: Plan-Driven Models: Incremental, Rapid Application Development (RAD), and Prototyping
Week 6: Advanced Process Models: Spiral Model, Concurrent Development, and Rational Unified Process (RUP)
Week 7: Agility Principles and Agile-Based Process Models
Week 8: Agile Process (Scrum): Teams, Artifacts, Sprints, and Ceremonies
Week 9: Modern Agile Extensions: eXtreme Programming (XP), Kanban, and DevOps
Week 10: Process Metrics and Software Process Improvement (SPI)
Week 11: Current Trends: Process Intelligence and Process Mining
Week 12-13: Software Process Improvement (SPI) Case Studies, Group Presentations, and Project Demos
Week 14: Synthesis: The Strategic Importance of Software Processes in Engineering

associated_skills: Hazard and Risk Analysis for Software Safety
course_content_outline: Week 1: Course Briefing: Instructional Plan, Attendance Rules, and Regulations
Week 2-3: Introduction to Software V&V: Definitions, IEEE Standard Foundations, and Documentations
Week 4: Managing V&V with SQA: Roles of Quality Assurance, Lifecycle Integration, and Standards
Week 5: Quality Metrics in V&V: Distinguishing Run-time Attributes (Performance, Security) from Intrinsic Qualities (Modifiability, Reusability)
Week 6: Software Reviews: Peer Code Reviews, Inspections, Walkthroughs, and Reporting
Week 7: Quality Control: Software Testing Overview, Black-box/White-box Testing, and Test Plan Design
Week 8: Human-Computer-Interface (HCI) Testing: Usability Aspects, Heuristic Evaluation, and User Testing Approaches
Week 9: Manual and Automation Testing: Strategic Overview, Tools, and Test Case Planning
Week 10: Quality Maturity Models and Problem Analysis: CMM, TMMi, and Software Failure Reporting
Week 11: Software Problem Analysis: Tracking and Analyzing Defect Data
Week 12: Quality Culture in V&V: Cultural Prerequisites for SQA and Developing SQA Roadmaps
Week 13: Safety and Security in V&V: Hazard and Risk Analyses, Identify Safety Requirements, and Safe Coding Practices
Week 14: Project Presentation and Reflection: OPBL Implementation as Software Testers and Experience Sharing

associated_skills: CRUD Operations with Firebase Firestore or SQLite
User Interface Interaction (Menus, Dialogs, Bottom Sheets)
Application Deployment (Google Play Store & Apple App Store)
course_content_outline: Week 1-2: Introduction to Mobile Applications: Platforms, Development Environments, and Modern Software Development Trends
Week 2: Getting Started with Flutter: Installation, Setup, and Introduction to the Dart Programming Language
Week 3: UI Architecture: Understanding Declarative UI Design and Component-based Architecture using Widgets
Week 4: Widget Lifecycle & State Management: Creating, Updating, and Disposing of Widgets and Managing App State
Week 5: User Interface Widgets: Building Dynamic Layouts with Containers, Rows, Columns, and ListViews
Week 6: User Input Controls: Implementing Text Fields, Buttons, Toggle Switches, and Image Displays
Week 7: Navigation and Intents: Implementing Page Routing and Data Passing between Screens using Navigator
Week 8: Notifications and Toast: Implementing Local/Push Notifications and Temporary UI Messages
Week 9: Data Persistence: Advanced Methods for Passing Data between Screens and Triggering User Notifications
Week 10: Interactive Elements: Implementing Menus, Pop-ups, and Alert Dialogs for Intuitive User Interaction
Week 11: Advanced Navigation: Exploring Bottom Navigation Bars, Side Drawers, and Popup Menu Buttons
Week 12: Custom UI Components: Creating Custom Dialogs and Modal Bottom Sheets for Enhanced User Experience
Week 13: CRUD Implementation: Developing a Mobile Application using Firebase Firestore or SQLite for Data Storage
Week 14: Application Deployment: Building, Testing, Signing, and Publishing Apps to Google Play and Apple App Stores
Week 1-2: Introduction to Computer Networks: Internet, Network Edge, Network Core, and Packet Switching concepts
Week 3-4: Application Layer: Principles of Network Applications, Web/HTTP protocols, and Domain Name Server (DNS)
Week 5-7: Transport Layer: Connection and Connectionless protocols, Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), and User Datagram Protocol (UDP)
Week 8-11: Network Layer: Forwarding and Routing, Datagram Networks, IP Protocol, and IPv4 Addressing
Week 12-14: Data Link Layer: Link Layer Services, Framing, Multiple Access Links, and Media Access Control (MAC) Addressing
Week 1-2: Overview of Operating Systems: Organization, Architecture, and OS Roles
Week 3-4: System Structures: OS Services, User Interfaces, Design, and Implementation
Week 5-6: Process Management: Concepts, Operations, Inter-process Communication, Threads, and Scheduling
Week 7: Process Coordination: Synchronization, Deadlock Characterization, Prevention, and Recovery
Week 8-9: Memory Management: Swapping, Paging, Segmentation, and Virtual Memory Concepts
Week 10: Storage Management: Disk Structure, Scheduling, RAID, and Mass-Storage Implementation
Week 11: I/O Systems: Hardware, Application Interfaces, and Kernel I/O Subsystems
Week 12: Protection and Safety: Goals, Principles, Domains, and Access Control Matrices
Week 13: Windows Case Study: History, Design Principles, System Components, and Networking
Week 14: Discussion on Modernization and Future Trends of Operating Systems
Week 1: Introduction to Programming: Computer Systems, Programs, and Programming Languages
Week 2: Introduction to C++: Language Syntax, Variables, Data Types, and Basic Input/Output
Week 3-4: Control Structures: Selection (if/else, switch) and Logical Operators
Week 5-6: Repetition Structures: Loops (for, while, do-while) and Nested Control Structures
Week 7-8: Functions: User-defined Functions, Parameter Passing (Value/Reference), and Scope
Week 9: Pointers: Pointer Variables, Initialization, and Interaction with Arrays
Week 10-11: Arrays: One-dimensional and Multi-dimensional Arrays and Array Processing
Week 12: Files: Sequential File Processing, Reading from and Writing to External Data Sources
Week 13: Structures (Structs): Defining and Processing Custom Data Types
Week 14: Review and Advanced Programming Concepts for Final Assessment

associated_skills: Clean Code Practices (Naming Conventions and Documentation)
course_content_outline: Week 1: Introduction to Object-Oriented vs. Procedural Programming and Advantages of OOP
Week 2: Core OOP Principles: Abstraction, Encapsulation, Information Hiding, and Extensibility
Week 3: Introduction to Java: Starting OOP development with the Java Language
Week 4: Creating Java Programs: Building functional OOP applications
Week 5: Java Identifiers: Rules and Code Conventions for Classes, Methods, and Variables
Week 6: Java Variables: Primitive, Reference, Instance, and Local Variables
Week 7: Class and Object: Class Diagrams, Accessor/Mutator Methods, and Constructors
Week 8: Predefined Classes: Utilizing String, Scanner, and JOptionPane for Input/Output
Week 9: Wrapper Classes: Numeric Data Type Wrappers and Parse Methods
Week 10: Static Members: Static Variables, Methods, and Modifiers
Week 11: Array of Primitives: Declaring, Creating, and Accessing Arrays using Enhanced For Loops
Week 12: Array of Objects: Memory Layout and Loop-based Object Processing
Week 13: Inheritance: Implementing 'is a' Relationships and Protected Modifiers
Week 14: Polymorphism: Writing Programs using Dynamic Method Binding and Polymorphic Behavior
